Title: Scope Boundary
Description: Locker room and support space fit-up may be claimed by DEL-02-01 (general interior) during aggregation, resulting in double-counting or gaps at the project level.
Impact: HIGH ($95,060 at risk -- 44.8% of estimate)

Title: Area Uncertainty
Description: Support space areas are assumed, not confirmed. Actual floor plan may differ significantly, especially for locker room (1,200 sf assumed) which drives the largest CBS category.
Impact: MEDIUM ($15,000 +/- range on locker room lines)

Title: Allowance Accuracy
Description: 5 ALLOWANCE items ($60,500 total) are based on professional judgment, not competitive pricing. Actual costs could vary +/- 40%.
Impact: MEDIUM ($24,000 +/- range)

Title: Wash Bay Option
Description: If Owner selects optional wash bay (SOW-0500), one PW bay is replaced, reducing bay count from 4 to 3. This reduces bay-area-driven costs by ~25% but adds wash bay conversion costs (separate DEL-05-01 estimate).
Impact: LOW ($13,000 reduction in DEL-02-03)

Title: Missing Scope
Description: Items that could arguably belong to DEL-02-03 but were excluded per cost ownership rules: overhead doors ($80,000), HVAC/ventilation ($44,000+), electrical ($14/sf on 8,400 sf = ~$118,000), bay sumps ($18,000). Total excluded scope: ~$260,000. If cost ownership rules change, this estimate would increase significantly.
Impact: HIGH (potential 2x increase)

Title: Fire protection may not be required by AHJ, leading to over-estimation of $108,000
Impact: AHJ confirmation during design phase; estimate clearly flags this as conditional with LOW confidence

Title: Actual building zone areas differ from assumed 6,400/6,400/5,200 split
Impact: Validate against architectural layout from DEL-02-01 when available; rerun estimate

Title: Compressed air scope boundary (CON-M-01) resolution could add scope to DEL-02-05
Likelihood: MEDIUM ($55,000 if breathing air system added per MS-08)
Impact: Brief excludes compressed air from DEL-02-05; if boundary ruling changes, add MS-08 pricing

Title: BAS/controls scope may be broader or narrower than full-building application
Impact: Confirm BAS scope during design; adjust L-11 area as needed

Title: Generator System Cost Exceeds Allowance
Scope Creep on Essential Loads List
Description: Scope Creep on Essential Loads List

Title: Double-Counting with Adjacent Deliverables
Seismic Anchorage Requirement
Actual utility run lengths significantly differ from assumed 120 m / 40 m due to actual stub locations and building siting
DEC-004 tie-in allowance ($35,000) is insufficient to cover actual tie-in execution costs
Impact: +$15,000 (if actual = $50,000 high end of UU-12 range)

Title: Utility connection fees exceed recommended parametric values
Cold Storage Building requires additional utility services (sanitary, telecom) not currently included
Impact: +$17,000 (sanitary $13K + telecom $4K)

Title: Common trench double-counting (UU-09 cost additive to individual utility rates which include trench)
Impact: -$10,000 (overstatement)

Title: Unknown underground conditions (rock, contamination, high water table) increase trenching costs

AEPA conditions of Water Act approval impose additional mitigation requirements (e.g., construction-phase environmental monitoring, post-construction monitoring, additional setback buffers) that require consultant services beyond FP-17 scope.
Impact: Confirm AEPA application status early in design phase; request pre-consultation with AEPA to scope conditions.

Title: 2021 Wetland Assessment and Environmental Assessment have lapsed or are deemed insufficient by AEPA, requiring new assessments.
Likelihood: HIGH ($15,000-$30,000+ for new assessments + new ABWRET-A calculation)
Impact: Confirm with AEPA whether 2021 reports remain accepted as basis for Water Act application.

Title: ABWRET-A wetland replacement fee has been recalculated by AEPA at a different amount than the 2021 figure of $10,769.54.
Impact: Confirm current ABWRET-A fee with AEPA or through updated assessment.

Title: Town of Penhold imposes additional flood fringe development conditions requiring additional environmental consultant effort or additional regulatory applications.
Impact: Engage Town planning department early to confirm flood fringe development requirements.

Title: Upstream DEL-03-02 outputs reveal that stormwater discharge points or earthwork volumes near the flood fringe require additional environmental assessment or regulatory coordination.
Impact: Coordinate DEL-03-02 and DEL-03-05 concurrently; flag any flood fringe earthwork volumes for environmental review.

Title: Market
Description: PEMB manufacturer pricing may differ from parametric rate ($32/sf) due to steel market volatility, lead times, or regional supply constraints.
Impact: MEDIUM ($24,000 variance at range endpoints: $168K to $210K)

Title: Scope
Description: PB-01 parametric rate may exclude minor shell components (e.g., specialized flashing, snow guards, fall protection anchors) that could be required for code compliance.
Impact: LOW (estimated $2,000-$8,000 for add-on items)

Title: Design
Description: Design engineering allowance ($10,000) may be insufficient if cold storage configuration requires more coordination effort than typical (e.g., complex aesthetic integration, specialized structural analysis).
Impact: LOW ($5,000-$10,000 additional)

Title: Actual pole quantity significantly differs from assumed 12 (could be 6-20 depending on site layout and spacing requirements)
Impact: Provide scaling formula to Owner; present as unit rate so total adjusts transparently

Title: Conduit run distance materially longer or shorter than 100 lm assumed
Likelihood: MEDIUM (fixed cost changes at $80/lm; +/- $2,000-$4,000 likely range)
Impact: Update when site plan from DEL-03-01 is available

Title: Parametric-origin rates ($7,500/pole; $80/lm) may not reflect actual supplier pricing at time of procurement
Impact: Obtain supplier quotes before final submission; consider using PriceMax for conservative estimate

Title: Soil conditions or underground obstructions increase conduit installation cost
Impact: Geotech investigation and utility locate as part of site development (DEL-03-02) would inform

Title: Actual zone count exceeds 10 once DEL-02-01 floor plan is finalized
Likelihood: Each additional zone adds ~$3,200 (range $2,500-$4,000 per OPT-07). 5 extra zones = ~$16,000 increase.
Impact: Re-run estimate with confirmed zone count once DEL-02-01 is available. Carry OPT-07 per-zone rate for sensitivity analysis.

Title: Parametric pricing significantly understates or overstates actual vendor quote
Likelihood: OPT-06 range is $35,000-$55,000 (57% spread). Vendor quote could fall outside this range.
Impact: Replace with vendor quote as soon as available. Flag to Owner that this is a placeholder estimate.

Title: Scope boundary disputes at interface with DEL-02-06 (electrical/IT)
Likelihood: Conduit, low-voltage power, or network costs may be double-counted or missed between deliverables if interface is not clearly coordinated.
Impact: Enforce cost ownership rules from brief. Coordinate with DEL-02-06 estimate during aggregation.

Title: Owner elects both access control (DEL-05-03) and security cameras (DEL-05-04), requiring integration
Likelihood: Integration costs (shared head-end, software, wiring synergies) are not priced. Could be a cost savings or additional cost depending on system selection.
Impact: If both options are elected, re-scope for integration opportunities per Guidance.md.

Title: Camera count changes significantly once floor plan is finalized (DEL-02-01)
Likelihood: MEDIUM -- price range for OPT-08 is $40k-$60k; more cameras could exceed range
Impact: Re-estimate after DEL-02-01 layout is available; obtain vendor quote with actual camera schedule

Title: Scope boundary between camera system (DEL-05-04) and IT infrastructure (DEL-02-06) is unclear for network equipment
Likelihood: MEDIUM -- potential for double-count or cost gap in network switches/PoE
Impact: Coordinate DEL-05-04 and DEL-02-06 estimates; define explicit scope split for network equipment before final pricing

Title: Parametric pricing significantly under- or over-estimates actual vendor quote
Likelihood: HIGH -- all lines are LOW confidence; OPT-08 range spans $20k ($40k-$60k)
Impact: Replace parametric pricing with competitive vendor quotes as soon as possible

Title: Monitoring service pricing does not reflect actual contract terms (multi-year, escalation, service levels)
Likelihood: LOW -- annual cost is $5,400; variance within $3,600-$7,200 range
Impact: Obtain monitoring service proposals; confirm contract structure (annual vs multi-year)

Title: Integration with access control (DEL-05-03) adds unpriced cost if both options are elected
Likelihood: LOW -- integration cost likely modest relative to system total
Impact: If both options are elected, add integration line item in a future estimate revision
